document_data.name: Tresset's Ringyl
document_data.mainbody: '''Tresset's Ringyl''' was a town in [[Tressardon]], long-destroyed by the mid–8{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Long overgrown, Tresset's Ringyl was full of trees. Only forty buildings were visible over their treetops. There was a castle in the middle, the [[Ringyl]].
document_data.Geography: The Ringyl sat inside a valley. It was east of [[Felmorel]], and further east was the [[Moonshorn Tower]].
document_data.Government: Once governed by the bandit [[Tresset]], Tresset's Ringyl had been the seat of the short-lived kingdom of Tressardon that he declared. However, the kingdom just about died with him, surviving him by onluy a few days.
document_data.History: In the {{yearlinkName|761}}, [[Elminster Aumar]], a [[Chosen of Mystra]], crossed Tresset's Ringyl while seeking [[Dasumia]]; he found the streets strewn with bones, and much ruin. He also gave the Ringyl a cursory exploration before spending the night in a nearby hilltop. That sorceress was in fact the Dasumia he sought.
